title: tf-legacy tensorflow 2.7.0 on ray cluster with latest_dlami: Assertion `listp != NULL' failed
body:
I get this error running tf-legacy on ray with latest commit f2725a4817526a15661fe8ee2195185fb89e7d6e
```
2022-02-09 11:56:28,109	INFO worker.py:843 -- Connecting to existing Ray cluster at address: 172.31.8.156:6379
2022-02-09 11:56:28.854854: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc:939] successful NUMA node read from SysFS had negative value (-1), but there must be at least one NUMA node, so returning NUMA node zero
2022-02-09 11:56:28.861166: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc:939] successful NUMA node read from SysFS had negative value (-1), but there must be at least one NUMA node, so returning NUMA node zero
2022-02-09 11:56:28.861818: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_gpu_executor.cc:939] successful NUMA node read from SysFS had negative value (-1), but there must be at least one NUMA node, so returning NUMA node zero
Inconsistency detected by ld.so: ../elf/dl-tls.c: 517: _dl_allocate_tls_init: Assertion `listp != NULL' failed!
```

If I downgrade to a813055daf06dcbfc82b83df53c8eb55228062d6 (the commit right before "Upgrade tf from 2.5.2 to 2.7.0")

Example ray config:
[cluster_g4dn_tf_2.yaml.zip](https://github.com/ludwig-ai/ludwig/files/8035846/cluster_g4dn_tf_2.yaml.zip)
